From the minute we stepped off the hydrofoil and entered the gates, I was taken with the grandeur -- of the grounds, of the gardens, of the fountains, and of the buildings (both inside and outside). Do not miss an afternoon at Peterhof!

Stunning gravity fed fountains. Take the hydrofoil out there if the weather is good, a wonderful cruise along the River Neva to the Gulf of Finland. Walk around and look at all the gilded statues and you must go and see the Great Cascades quite the best 18th century working fountains that I have seen. Too much walking for anybody with mobility problems though I think you may be able to rent a golf buggy....saw several around.

Amazing place and country. Amazing place to visit , it is beautiful and breathtaking in the grounds that surround the museum. Museum is the wrong word, this is one of Russia's treasures . The building is adorned in beautiful decoration and works of art which is not normally my cup of tea but I enjoyed the visit to Peterhof. But to me the grounds where the best , with the fountains and beautiful garden and surroundings it was truly a positive experience I won't forget , we loved it . Just one word of advice , DONT even think of lighting a cigarette anywhere near the building ( I don't smoke) but the people that thought they could smoke outside the building where positively delt with and will think twice wherever they are in the future about pulling those cigarettes out even in there own home. Why would anyone think they could light up a cigarette in the doorway of a national treasure is beyond me . Anyway if you go to St Petersburg visit Peterhof . Take an umbrella because if it rains you won't wonder those beautiful gardens and you will miss out.
Peterhof. A must see! I don't think I have ever seen anything so grand! Beautiful Palace & words cannot express the beautiful grounds & statuary!

Another show stopper close to St Petersburg. Only went to the gardens. They are jaw dropping. Most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. Bonus - Walked the beach on my way to the ferry back to L'Hermitage and it was covered with deep green sea glass!

Peterhof is beautiful - inside and out. This fantastic palace is a feast for the eyes. Would have loved to be able to take pictures. The gardens and multiple fountains are qequally spectacular. Well worth the trip outside the city. Hightly recommend a guide. We used Marina Wilson and were well satisfied.

Well preserved gardens and fountains. Spent several hours on the grounds strolling through the many gardens, viewing the spectacular fountains, and walking the palace grounds. The Palace itself was not open to regular tours. Not a good fit for anyone with mobility problems or handicapped wheel chair individuals. Miles of walking around the gardens.

Crowded and sumptuous. Get a prebooked timed ticket. You only have time to gawk at the opulence before being moved on and you can get pressed by the tour groups, but it is really worth it.One thing to bear in mind is that the palace was gutted to burnt walls and little else as the Germans left it in WWII, so what you are seeing is yet more extensive and expensive restoration. The grounds are beautiful with the famous cascades and buildings. Allow the best part of a day to see it all. No picnics allowed in the grounds :(
So much GOLD. Opulence and splendour seem like trite words when it comes to Peterhof. Give yourself a lot of time to enjoy this spectacle.

Dazzling golden fountains.. Unfortunately our tour only included the gardens. Oh to have more time in St. Petersburg. However the Palace when first seen does not look as impressive as the Catherine palace. However walk down the terrace and view the building from the Baltic and the building suddenly imposes itself on the scene. The fountains are magnificent and the gardens full of trees and wide walks. You could spend the whole day here half in the palace and half in the Gardens.

OUTSTANDING. We had half day tour and was simply outstanding. We took a hydrofoil boat from central St. petersburg to Peterhof. Do not miss this even if diesel smell from engine room troubles you. The fountains and the garden were simply awesome. The palace and the museum is great, full of history and jaw dropping collection. The Gardens are definitely one of the finest in the World.

Simply astounding. Such an iconic building. The fountains, landscaping and significance to Russian History is truly awe inspiring. If you can, find a tour that will allow for plenty of time to visit the Gardens. Be prepared for long line ups to get into the Palace and for fast moving tour groups.

Arrive early, stay late. All that glitters like gold - is! Make sure you experience the grand opening of the fountains, view it from one of the bridges across the Grand Canal; the music you hear is the song for St. Petersburg - simply fabulous.

The fine print. The most gorgeous grounds and fountains -- could spend a day just wandering around. I'd recommend bringing a picnic. The trip over was a quick 30minutes, but the vessel provided no outside seating and the diesel smell was hard to avoid. Would recommend a careful reading of all ticket policies -- standing in line for an hour only to be told that non-Russian tourists had to wait even longer was unexpected, as was the additional fee for each and every building on the island. Peter spent his money wisely to create a breathtakingly beautiful retreat -- visiting was a high point of the trip!
Peterhof. We did not go inside the museum, but the gardens, the fountain system are absolutely breath taking. It rivals Versailles!

Amazing gardens!. The fountains and gardens of this palace are as good as it gets. Although not nearly as large as the gardens of Versaille, the fountains are in some ways more spectacular than Versaille. We took a hydrofoil boat to Petehof from central St. Petersburg and the ride was kind of fun. Don't miss this.

Well, just when you think you have seen it all. We had two days in St Petersburg, being on a Royal Caribbean cruise. Our guide was excellent, she was organised through Royal Caribbean and we had the luxury of headsets for both days, suing the same tour guide.I think her name was Annie, she was obviously well educated and knew everything and was very pleasant to boot. You cannot take photos inside Peterhof, it was very crowded on a Sunday afternoon, but the place was just spectacular. Gold, gold, gold and the furnishings are indescribable.The water gardens are unbelievable, I have never seen anything like them at all. Did not eat here but used the toilets which, from memory, were good. There are lots of stalls outside selling all sorts of Russian things and lots of cafes too, no need to eat before going. It is quite a way out of town though, I am not sure how you would use public transport to get there. Hope this helps.

Difficult with small children. As with all the palaces, this is a feast for the eyes and a history lesson. However, if you are travelling with children in pushchairs, you will find this difficult: (a) the staff will not let you take your pushchair into the palace, and so you will have to persuade little Johnny to walk; (b) the guided tour groups - the only way of seeing the palace - are crammed together and so you will have to carry little Johnny.

Glad we were with a large tour group!. What a confusing chaotic trip. There was a national holiday so the bus had a hard time parking. The gold fountains were amazing but there was so many people! People from our group were getting pulled away by the crowd. We went down to the grounds and it wasn't as bad. We saw a little fountain with a pug dog chasing ducks and heard an acapella group sing in a little cottage. I think the tour guide was hoping it would be less crowded later in the day. Inside it was crushing but very picturesque. I'm glad we went but I probably won't go again. I can see now why the cruise ship offers night tour options. I might be tempted to take the night tours and do something else during the day.

Get on the boat and visit it. Half hour pretty expensive boat trip to get there but it is worth the time and the money. Beautiful garden and fountains, unique scenery, marvellous view, hard to catch similar anywhere.

Great gardens. the Peterhof is a reconstructed palace having destroyed in the siege of Leningrade. The Nazi offensive destroyed all but some of the walls. So, recommend that you concentrate your visit on the vast gardens,fountains and outbuildings. It is a mini Versailles. Really well cared for with exceptional flowers for the season. If you can take the hydrofoil back to St Petersburg for some great views

nice place-extremely poor customer info and service. nice place to visit and most frustrating place also.. no security speak English, no proper signage.. the story is DO NOT QUEUE for hours at outside ticket booth to buy palace ticket ...non Russian tourist have priority access from 14h30 to 16h30 with ticket sold inside the palace (not the ticket booth outside) and very easy to get..
Amazing Fountains. Excellent gardens and places to buy souvenirs. There is so much history all around you. We had such a lovely day touring the building and grounds.

Must go. First you take a hydrofoil you see in James Bond movies from the 60s just cool to take the boat alone. You pick it up from the backside of the hermitage but the palace grounds is more impressive than Paris the palace not as nice but very nice but Paris wins on that but the grounds and fountains Russia rules

Dont miss this place. It is beautiful, especialy during sommer period I can recommend boat trip from very city center to Peterhof.
Nice place to walk around and rest, many great fountains and waterfalls, nice surrounding

Peterhof. We traveled by boat to see this beautiful place. Since we were on a two-day stop in St. Petersburg, we did not go inside but toured the lovely gardens and fountains. Our tour guide (Alla Tours) was so knowledgeable and was able to guide us through the gardens.

A mans house. If you visit Catherines Palace you will see a womans house-jewel box. Her place is grand, lot of gold, more mirrors, paintings of men, and am amber room, a womans house. You go to Peters house, you will see great fountains showing virility, grand palace, some gold, lot of paintings of battles, diversified interior, paintings of women with a lot of bare breasts. A mans house. Take a coat, on the Baltic with the boats the wait can be windy and cold. You take the Perhof express from the Hermitage.

One of the most beautiful Fountains on Earth. We took our 4.5 year old and 3 year old to run around the gardens and visit the fountains. They loved the hydrofoil ride to the fountains and loved running and climbing all over the grounds. This is a must while staying in St. Petersburg. If you take the 10 am hydrofoil you should make the music and show they have at 11 am when they turn the fountains on in the morning.

Do not miss this palace and garden. We used "Best Guides" tour company in St. Petersburg. They took care of our travel visa! Overwhelming beauty and the gardens need to be seen first hand. Photos will never be enough!

WOW. This is quite a palace and seems like it is so exceptional for being a Summer home for Peter the Great. !00's of fountains and water jets on the property and states and gardens of great charm. I will take you a few days to seriously enjoy Peterhof. What a time well spent in Russia.
what a place. i can't get over it... this place was completely destroyed and then recreated to its originality. wow wow wow.worth a day to be there.

Fountains, fountains, fountains. You can not go to St Petersburg & not see Peterhof Castle and gardens! Incredible oppulance. More that 150 gravity feed fountains, so water is never recirculated, just runs straight to the Gulf of Finland. A canal runs from the Gulf all the way up to the castle ending at one of the massive fountains with gold leaf covered statues. There are several smaller castles on the grounds. It would take a day just to see the gardens. The Castle interior tour is 2 hours at least. Inside you wear shoe covers as you walk on all the inlaid wood floors as you get overwhelmed my all the gold, treasures, and antiques. Spectacular!

Gardens . The gardens are beautiful but it was so cold and windy. We had to escape to the restaurant, the doors were open while we were sitting there.
The gardens are so magnificant. Just prepared for the wind coming from Baltic Sea.

Fantastic palace and gardens. One of the attractions you must see in St. Petersburg. Unbelievable beauty both indoors and out, and the gardens are so much fun with their tricky water features. Well worth the trip. It does get crowded on popular days, but it's so big you can usually find a place that is less crowded.

Glorious. Visited gardens only (buildings are closed on Mondays), but above and beyond our expectations. Took hydrofoil from quayside outside the Winter Palace/Hermitage. Very exciting way to travel. Locals consider it an expensive option (about £18 return), but well worth it for the dramatic half hour ride.Gardens are magnificent. Be aware it can be very windy along the shore side, so take layers.

Jaw-Dropping Grandeur. This is the quintessential Baroque baroque palace! There is so much gold gilt you will have gold withdrawal when you leave. It really is a must-see. The fountains and grounds are beautiful. There is much to see, so wear comfortable walking shoes and plan to spend the day.

One of Many Must Sees. When if St Petersburg there are a few must sees and the fountains and gardens of Peterhof are one of them. Vast park area contains over 150 fountains including numerous cascades, gilded statues and lush flower beds. View the Gulf of Finland and downtown St Petersburg from across this vast waterway.

only saw gardens no tour of inside of museum. i did enjoy the fountains but roads were dirt and wet from rain and very hard to use with a scooter again i was disappointed not to go inside peterhof however in all fairness to company i may have only booked gardens that did not include place
AMAZING - MOST SEE. Saint Petersburg is beautiful but Peterhofis absolutely amazing! If you are there, a trip to St. Petersburg without visiting is not worth it.
Absolutely beautiful. The gardens and the fountains are awesome! A very beautiful place to visit and to have lunch nearby.

Peterhof Gardens and Palace a must visit. If you are visiting Saint Petersburg, this is one of the places to visit but it will take you most of a day. If going by hydrofoil and returning by car (or vice versa), not being rushed, taking plenty of photos and taking in the parklands and main palace, plus having a light snack, need to allow 5 hours. Boat trip is under 30 minutes with car journey 1-1.5 hours and 2.5-3 hours for inside and through gardens. If you chose to visit all the museums and palaces on site, would add another hour+. We had our own guide, tour group sizes over 10 people appeared to have difficulty getting every one to hear what was being said. Audio guides are also available in multiple languages and would be useful as signage in each room (Russian & English) is not detailed. Must leave bags and coats at checkin, no lockers, but secure and efficient process. No photos allowed inside but plenty of books and postcards on offer in the gift shop. Only one set of stairs to negotiate in and out. We had no trouble with crowds on a Thursday in May. My tip is arrive in time to be outside for when fountains commence at 11am with an accompanying symphony broadcast through the park. Then do your walk through the main palace. From 11am fountains run continuously until close.

Amazing park with the most beautiful fountains in the world . You can go in this place by bus from metro station Baltijskaya, from bus station to Petergof 5 minutes by walking. In park you can go without lines, tickets are sold on entrance. Park is really amazing, a lot of beautiful views are opened there. I was afraid about big palace, because you should stay in two huge lines, before for tickets and then for entrance and time of work cash and the museum is limited, so a few people couldn't visit it. I don't understand this terrible service, why they can't sell one tickets for all places for wishing and one tickets for park for instance. Also you should take off your clothes in one place and backpacks in other and after visiting museum you should go through crowed for your things and then come back on the exit, it's crazy. Tickets for foreign people cost more expansive than for citizenship of Russia, but tour only in Russian language, there isn't audio guide in English or other languages. We spent 3 hours on staying in the lines, it's terrible. People without tour can't visit this palace normal. Also I liked tour in grottos, but it's only in Russian language too, there is interesting information about fountains.

Impressive. Visit Peterhof and it is easy to see why they had a revolution - lifestyles of the royal family. An amazing rehabilitation of the estate after the destruction during the Great Patriotic War. Not to be missed if visiting St Petersburg. Check the timing for the fountains to be switched on.

Fabulous place a must see. This is worth the drive to see. Gorgeous property on the Baltic sea with amazing wTer fountains and gardens. The only negative is the amount if people visiting. A fitting home fir royalty and mr.

Two day tour of St. Petersburg. On the TJ Travel tour I did there was only time to visit the gardens as we were also visiting Catherine's Palace the same day. The gardens are truly magnificent - the lower gardens are all formal in various styles most with a fountain in the centre. There are three cascades - the Chess Cascade, the Golden Mountain and the most famous the Grand Cascade with Samsons fountain. This is truly magnificent, as the statues lining the cascade and the numerous fountains are all covered in gold. Peterhof is a MUST see on your visit to St. Petersburg and it certainly is possible to see this and Catherines Palace in the same day even though they are a distance apart.

Magnificent. Really showcased the opulence of royalty. There is a lot to see and a lot of walking is done to see it. The interior is breathtaking and at times way over the top. The fountains were a sight to see. If its windy you will get wet, so be careful on the stairs. Visited at the end of April when it was about 50 degrees out. There was quite a crowd. There are actors in period costumes to take pictures with and vendors selling souvenirs throughout the grounds. You can also but tasty treats. The view of the Gulf of Finland is magnificent. There are several fountains throughout the grounds. Some that the kiddos can get wet from if desired. The museum was quite warm during my visit. I'm not sure if this was on purpose or because of the crowds. No picture taking is allowed in the palace but there are many photo opportunities while wondering through the garden.

Fountains!. You have to see the fountains in action. If you're in Saint Petersburg, book a trip our to the Peterhof (Peter the Great's Palace) and make sure you see the water show. Absolutely stunning!
Beautiful place. Beautiful gardens and a nice palace. The main attraction is the fountain, but the palace interior is also interesting. Unfortunately, pictures are not allowed inside

Best time to go is in the spring.. Best time to go is in spring. It was cold there in May, so the flowers were still in buds just waiting to burst into color. The grounds were still very beautiful--especially the fountains.

A taste of Russian/European royal lifestyle and history lesson on Peter the Great. The main fountain with gardens, the trick fountains, the beautiful silk walls and furniture of each of the rooms plus the marvelous wood work on the floors. Having a knowledgable guide is a must to enjoy this place!Avoid going in the cold weather as the gardens are not in bloom and the weather can be uncomfortable to walk around the property.
Amazing Complex. Fabulous Gardens, amazing fountains, beautiful Palaces. Going to do a bunch of walking to see everything. We didn't get to go into the palaces, but the grounds are fabulous.

Just Delight!. The centerpiece of the composition of occupies the lower park with fountains. Together with the upper garden, it forms the oldest part of the ensemble. The upper garden, with an area of 15 hectares, was laid out under Peter I. Peter used the garden to grow vegetables. Later in the second half of the XVIII century, the upper garden did undergo a substantial modification into a modern looking regular park with statues and fountains, like "Oaken", "Neptune", Fountains Square ponds. Near the main entrance of the upper garden is the "Mezheumny" or "Uncertainty" with a ferocious dragon in the center surrounded by four spouting dolphins. But of course the main magic artwork is the lower park with its numerous fountains. Every year when the fountains rekindle, is a big day of celebration. The central axis of the park forms the Grand Cascade and the Sea Canal with the lustrous «Samson tearing the lion's mouth» fountain. It is believed that the figure of Samson appeared in connection with the Poltava victory of Russian troops over the Swedes. Equidistant from the sea channel visitors will discover fountain "Adam" and "Eve" cascades "Chess Mountain" and "Gold Mountain" Monplaisir Palace and Hermitage Pavilion. In the western part of the park, visitors will find the Marly Palace. I would recommend at least plan to spend one day on the visit of Peterhof, so you can explore everything in a relaxed feeling.

Amazing. Beautiful gardens, Trick Fountains, take the hydrofoil from St Petersburg to get to Peterhof. The inlay wood floors. It truly is a magical place. If you love history and romance you must visit this place. We went in September and the weather was in the low 70's.

Palace and park complex; one of the homes of the Tsars. The grounds of this palace complex are spectacular, with golden fountains, nymphs, sculptures, and formal gardens. The palace itself is attractive (guided tours are not mandatory here), and many of the other buildings are worth seeing, especially Monplaisir, the private residence of Peter the Great. The complex is best reached by boat from St Petersburg - tickets are sold outside Gostiniy Dvor and around the Hermitage.

Summer Holiday in St. Pete. Beautiful gardens and palace, make sure you plan to be there when the fountains are operating. The long lines and crowds are a bit annoying but it is definitely worth it. There is a nice restaurant in the gardens featuring some traditional dishes with game meats that is a great place to have lunch.

WOW!!!!. We were able to take the hydrofoil from St Petersburg to get to Peterhof and avoid the traffic getting here in the summer. We arrived on a summer day beautiful day and the visit here was the highlight of 2 full days of touring in St petersburg. While the building is lovely inside, the superbly manicured and landscaped gardens and the beautiful golden fountains are what made Peterhof so memorable for us. Watching the magical water fountains was a phenomenal experience. The whole area is a photographer's dream. Definitely a must -see!
Spectacular. It was a gorgeous visit, recommend anyone who can time it at the closing or opening of the fountains

Stunning. Amazing number of rooms restored to very high standard. Very grand. Some room attendants keep you moving - I can understand when it's busy to stop dawdlers clogging up the rooms, but when it is off season and very quiet it is not necessary. Garden sculptures still under cover and fountains off, but still a magnificent palace and worth the trip in the off season.

Better to see in summer. 4 stars only not to spoil the rating of this respected sightseeing. The truth is that one should go there during summer time - when fontains work. However, even though we were informed of that we decided to go to get at least some impression as all our friends who were lucky to see it in summer consider it to be the most impressive sightseeing in St. Petersburg

Fountains But Beware. Of course the gardens and fountains ARE wonderful but realize that all the water fountains are not pump driven but by gravity. Interesting they do not turn on the fountains until 10 am. BEWARE--Don't even think about touching the walls in the palace--my wife got her hand slapped by the room's moniter' s fan as she brushed the room's doorknob. You must try the blini at the snack bar--they are like crapes.

A beautiful day trip.. The location and gardens are spectacular, and the hundreds of fountains and statues make a day spent in the grounds truly wonderful.The house and artwork are amazing but also not to be missed is a visit to the bath house and kitchen

parks parks parks. One of us got lost in the park. And cold showers ran down the spine of his wife cause the park is sooo huge. Numerous fountains from the largest Sampson murdering a lion to timy tricky fountains.

Absolutely breath taking.. A photographer's paradise as so much to see and enjoy in this location.
Located on the coast of the Baltic Sea and a high speed hydrofoil trip back to St. Petersburg.
Amazing. Another museum to make part of your preferable list in Culture. Este é outro Museu a considerar na tua lista se te interessas por arte!

The most amazing gardens that could rival Versailles. The Great thing about the Peterhof Place, is not the Palace itself, but the Gardens, full of fountains and fountain games which reflected Peter the Greats playful character, this place is a must if you are in the city for 2-3 days. Also you can catch a hydrofoil there from just outside the Winter Palace, so it is a pleasant and traffic free trip there, which really increases the appeal in the Summer

Versaille with working fountains. Soooooo much gold leaf. It really is glorious. In the sunshine the glittering can really mess with your camera exposure so be a bit careful. The fountains are truly spectacular as Peter the Great wanted ones that didn't have to hand pumped as he walked by. Check out his very modest little "bungalow" where he retired with the first Catherine the Cook. Allow several hours to stroll the gardens.

amaizing park. everytime when we have a guests we used to show them this beautiful part of our historical capital of Russia, The huge area with beautiful fountains and landscapes are so breathtaking! must visit!

Is not opens every day. Be in mind that is not open all days. Check the calendar before going there, because is a expensive boat ride.Saint Petersbug main atractions are worth a long visit.This is probaly the city that has everything in the way that you will never forget.
Nice place. Huge collection of art. It is a visit through History. We had learnt a lot about the rich old times of Russia there.

Avoid in winter months. Much like other Peterhof attractions, it's to be avoided in the winter, you're better off exploring the city rather than its suburbs. So if you don't go in June/July, then it's better to allocate even more time to Hermitage etc.

Beautiful Palace, but save it for the summer. Because the fountains are only open during the summer, I would recommend skipping the visit to Peterhof in winter and just visit Catherine's Palace in Pushkin instead.

Tour guide is a must. We hired a tour guide for our visit to St Petersburg. This was a big help on many occasions. When trying to get into a museum the line are always very long, and time consuming. Having a tour guide, you can get in early in some places, or skip the long line and get right in. This place we were able to skip the long line. That was a big plus. This place will take you hours to get through the buildings and the outside park. You cannot take pictures inside the museum, but you can outside by buying a photo pass.

You just need two days!. Peterhof is a large place. For tourist like me, you just need two days to explore the place in detail. Slowly walking in the forest, appreciating each item and decor in each museum. Please also be reminded to visit the place on Saturday because all museums opens on Saturday but not every weekday. (some opens everyday, some every Saturday and Friday, some every Saturday and Sunday...)

Journey into the past. The most interesting experience is the travel by hydrofoil. There are picturesque views of the city and Finlandia Bay anglomeration. The palace itself and accompaning objects are nice, but always in shadow of Versaille.

Go with a tour guide or you will never see everything. Amazing place HUGE a must to have an organised tour or you will just line up for hours to get in,and you will miss half of the exhibits as it is massive.

Peterhof with Albina was Fantastic!. Albina guided me around Peterhof on a gorgeous autumn day with the golden leaves falling off the trees and the fountains in full display. It was such a pleasant day I shall remember it always! The grounds of the palace were just perfect and Albina's knowledge of the grounds and her pleasant and efficient demeanor allowed us to see everything there and return to the city in time for our afternoon tour. Our city tour was impressive as we saw all the sights included in the tour and Albina took me to some that were not listed and this made our tour that much more memorable. Albina is very efficient and quite personable. Her willingness to share her insights on the history of her city as well as give a local's view of current events made my trip just perfect. Thank you Albina!

Fantastic. This was one of my favorite places to visit in St Petersburg!! I have been there a few times. It is impressive and a great place to visit with friends, family, your love or on your own!! A MUST SEE!!

Stunning . Watching the water fountains is one of the most powerful memories of my life. The music and the overwhelming grandeur are an experience of a lifetime. The grounds are more impressive than the palace but the palace itself is well worth a visit.

On a wonderful sunny summer day. Arriving over water,and walking up the grand canal approach on a very hot summers day. Magnificent. We were guided , so toilets and refreshment was pointed out .Very crowded in places , but able to move around and get the essential photos.

Magical amidst snow. I visited Peterhof in January. There were few visitors and there were instances when I was able to view rooms on my own. Being able to view the collection at my own pace in an uncrowded room made up for missing the fountains in winter. Seeing the palace surrounded by snow is a sight to behold. But it would be nice to return in summer to see the fountains. Picture taking is not allowed inside the museum.
Peterhof. Loved it, Fantastic display of waterfalls. You have to be there at a specific time. The guide made sure we were there to see the display.
Summer Palace in Winter. We knew the fountains were off in Winter, but, there was hardly anyone there to mar the views of the unbelievably ornate rooms in the Palace.

The Russian Versailles. Peter the Great built this palace with its fountain- laced gardens and extensive property. It sits atop a hill and overlooks the Baltic. We arrived by boat after we visited the Hermitage Museum. It was a nice stroll up from the boat dock. The fountains were lovely. The interiors were quite elaborate and reeked of the Romanovs. It was built in the early 1700's and was a landmark of Russian artistic culture. Superlatives don't do it justice. You can close your eyes and imagine what it must have been like 200 - 300 years ago.

Splendorous Gardens and fountains!. Located near the Gulf of Finland, this is a much smaller Palace compared with the Tsarskoye Seló , and so the rooms inside it, where you can not take pictures of any of theme, but very nice decorations in the rooms they let you see. , but what is really amazing in this Palace are its gorgeous fountains that run down the beautiful stairs... You just get surprised by the mecanism they pump the water with! There is also a large park around it, with a special place for kids, where they love getting soaked with little water fountains, so, if you travel with children to this magnificent place and in summer time, make sure to bring a bathingsuit or extra clothes . Very enjoyable park!

Must-See. When it's warm, the sun is out, and the fountains are turned on, this might be one of the most beautiful places in the world. Clear evidence that Peter was truly Great. Sitting on a rock and staring out into the Bay of Finland offers an indescribable sense of peace.

Picture Perfect. Arrival by hydrofoil from the city really sets you up for probably what is one of the major highlights of a visit to St Petersburg. Luckily it was a beautiful day and the sun made the buildings positively gleam. The grounds are lovely and don't miss the trick fountains.
very beautiful gardens. very beautiful gardens , sculptures and view. and of course breathtaking fountains with golden sculptures under blue sky with some white clouds and smell of Finland gulf sea.
The highlight. The grounds are beautifully kept. The fountains and statues are simply brilliant. We weren't able to go into the palace due to renovations, but the grounds were worth the visit.

Golden Paradise. This palace may be smaller than many others in Russia, but the grounds are amazing. The grounds are called the Great Cascade. The number of beautiful, gold gleaming statues adorning the Great Cascade will dazzle and leave you awestruck!

Don't miss this. This is a must see for St Petersburg. Take the hydrofoil from the dock opposite The Hermitage for a wonderful trip getting there. Get a good guide book before you go as there are so many fantastic stories about the fountains, gardens and statues. Well worth spending time walking all over.

A Must See.. This is mostly about seeing the grounds so pick a decent day if you can. The site is spectacular. The town of Puskin is lovely. See internet photos of Peterhof in 1944 after the Nazi's destroyed it. You won't believe the then and now.

Surprised that I liked it!!. i've seen one too many castles in my travels and was not really looking forward to this tour but it was included in our St. Petersburg tour. It's worth it. What makes this even more interesting is that we went last week. - the fountains were off and it was snowing - and it was still worth it. In fact maybe we liked it more as there was no crowd. The sheer opulence is truly one of a kind in this world. ( and this is after being overwhelmed by the Hapsburg Palace in Austria ).

Worth going for the gardens.. The queueing is the worst thing and then having to wait to part with coats,bags etc once you do get in and then covers on your shoes----so please do not ever think of--- going in heeled shoes---definitely a no-no! Once inside no photographs are allowed but you can make up for that by taking many of the beautiful gardens and fountains. Do try to return to the city by hydrofoil as it does complete the visit by seeing the city from the river.

first time of me & the Baltic Ocean. The Palace wasn't different from the picture in the book or website I'd researched before arrival notwitheless the Baltic Ocean was my incidentally fulfilled my itinerary. We had lunch nearby and walked long the ocean to find the newlywed's celebration. :)

Simply gorgeous. We took the hydrofoil across to the island on which the Peterhof Palace is situated. The road trip is a couple of hours. It is essential that you get there in time to see the start of the fountains when a ceremony takes place. Don't miss the opening!! The gardens are lovely with numerous canals and fountains. Beautifully kept. Wear sensible walking shoes as there's lots of walking but a must-see in St Petersburg.

Stunning Palace and Gardens!!!. Everything was fabulous, especially the gardens and the Fountain Musical Event!!! This is another location that requires at least a full day!!! It is more child friendly than the Hermitage, but not by much.

Spectacular. Peterhof truly is a wonderful place to "stroll in the park". The big attraction is the gravity fed fountains which live up to expectations. Keep an eye out for some of the more quirky trick fountains like the 'run the gauntlet' fountain that's only switched on a couple of times a day which the kids love. A great place to visit.

Outstanding, especially in autumn. We went round the gardens and just for that it was well worth the visit. In summer it is apparently extremely busy so October is a good time to wander around at your leisure without too many other tourists around (of course, everything is relative!)...

Extreme opulence.. We had a perfect day for our visit. Traveled by hydrofoil to get there, which was very easy, and were in awe of the fountains and palace. Beautiful gardens, very formal but still lovely. The statues and fountains are like nothing I've seen before so we were wowed by it!

Amazing. This is Russia's version of the gardens of Versailles in France. The gardens and the fountains were spectacular. So worth spending an afternoon walking through the various parts of the gardens and enjoying the views. Because of the size of the whole park it doesn't feel crowded. The palace was nice but not super special.

Spectacular palace with magical fountains & gardens. Whilst on a cruise around the Baltic in 2008 we called into the port of St Petersburg. There we went on a tour of the palace of Peterhof. The palace was wonderful with a glint of gold everywhere. The gardens were pristine and beautiful following the paths to river which flow out to sea. Then there was the magical fountains operated by a gravity fed system along side golden statues on different levels with water cascading down to the river with more fountIns either side. A real spectacular not to be missed.

Beautiful gardens on multiple levels. The gardens at Peterhof are amazing. There are several fountains and levels. The greenery is pristinely kept. You can reach the gardens by steps, or there are pathways that will guide you. If you take the paths, there are more gardens and a cottage where food is served. (Sandwiches, desserts, cold drinks and rest rooms)
Great unless you have seen Versailles. This is a copy of Versailles - so if you have been to V, then don't go to Peterhof...otherwise, it is lovely and interesting.

Peaceful garden. The garden and the palace is very clean and peaceful. You can see the the reachment everywhere. In the reastaurant you must wait alot becouse the waiters are so busy. Don't miss the boat

Lush Life. Our hydrofoil ride to this attraction was uncomfortable and closed in, so it was a relief to step into the open air. We gradually took in our enchanting surroundings and quickly fell in love. Beautiful gardens, each with a story to tell. Playful fountains, cooling arbors, classical symmetry in all.We did not visit the inside of the palace but the grounds alone are worth the trip.Do dress comfortably and watch for pickpockets.

WOW!!!!!!. The Peterhof is considered the Versailles of the East and it lives up to its name. The palace itself is magnificent but it is the garden area that is truly beautiful. There's an Italian garden and a French garden and the fountain statues are gilded in gold. It sits on the Bay of Finland and is truly worth a day's visit. One of the highlights of my trip to St Petersburg.

Peterhof is Wonderful, a Must-See outside St Petersburg.. On my 3rd visit to Peterhof, there was still more to see. It's amazing to have seen it transform from a 1970 school visit when fountains didn't work and the gardens didn't exist to 1994 when money had turned the splendid cascades back on... to now. The lake is serene and beautiful with its surrounding pleasure palaces and restored boathouses that I didn't know existed. The view across the Gulf of Helsinki is exquisite and the trick fountains entertain all.10:00 am the glorious fountains turned on to musical fanfare. We enjoyed the interior but for glamorous rooms, Catherine Palace has the edge for me. What made the visit was a lovely sunny day for September 11th, 2014. The upper gardens were amazing with the sun just perfect at 9:30am. I'll try to add photos.
Phenomenal. My wife & I had been wanting to visit Peterhof for many years. It was even better than we expected. Not only the buildings themselves but the grounds were really something to see.
